value.title: DAX Fridays! #181: Can't covert text into dates using DAX? Here is why...
value.excerpt: You should use power query to convert text into dates in power bi, but if you have a direct query or live connection and you need to do it in DAX, here is a tutorial of what works, what doesnt and what to watch for.  Enjoy!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.excerpt: In this video we are going to cover 53 (!) DAX / Power BI best practices. value.title: DAX Fridays! #199: Using curly brackets in DAX expressions?
value.excerpt: Have you used curly brackets when writing DAX? In today's video we will explore when and how you can use them.   Happy Friday!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about Power and Excel BI! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJ7UhloHSA4wAqPzyi6TOkw?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: DAX Fridays! #26: Break RANKX ties with RAND()
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how DAX RAND function works and also how to use it to break ties on the RANKX calculation to be able to create TOP X lists in Power BI.  Link to pbix file: TopN file link: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/rank-dax  Link to RANKX file: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z2qzJVeYhTY

value.title: DAX Fridays! #30: SEARCH vs FIND
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays! tutorial we are going to go though examples on how to use two DAX functions: SEARCH and FIND  SEARCH and FIND DAX functions are used to find the number of characters at which a specific word is found in a column.  Link to Power BI file used in the video: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/search-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays! #31: Rounding Time, Prices and Numbers with DAX
value.excerpt: In today‚Äôs DAX Fridays video I will show you how to round time, prices and numbers using ROUND, ROUNDUP, ROUNDDOWN, INT, TRUNC, ODD, EVEN, MROUND, FLOOR and CEILING.  Rounding numbers, time and prices is a very useful skill as it will give you more control of your dataset and the accurancy in which your

value.title: DAX Fridays! #33: Quick Measures
value.excerpt: In today's video I will review the new functionality released by Microsoft in the April 2017 Power BI update called Quick Measures.  Quick Measures is a new featured that has been released as a preview feature, so if you want to start using it, you need to activate it under Options and preview features.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #34: UNICHAR and REPT
value.excerpt: In today‚Äôs video I will show you  two new DAX functions: UNICHAR and REPT  UNICHAR DAX function allows you to display unicode symbols in Power BI and Excel.   REPT allows you to repeat text using DAX.  With both functions you can create a star rating visualization among other cool things.  Chris Web

value.title: DAX Fridays! #42: SUBSTITUTE (multiple values)
value.excerpt: In today's video, we will learn how to use the DAX function SUBSTITUTE.  Substitute changes text for another text. value.excerpt: Who is the best player, Duran or LeBron? Let's find out using statistics and standard deviation.
